fields.headline: Xavier pushed out to Galatasaray
fields.bodyText: Liverpool have released defender Abel Xavier on a year's loan to Galatasaray, a deal which will be made permanent as long as the player doesn't fail to impress. The Portuguese defender leaves Anfield one week short of a year since his move from Everton, after just 21 games for the Anfield outfit. "Abel will go on loan for the remainder of the season," Liverpool manager Gerard Houllier said. "They will then have an option to buy." Xavier joined Liverpool from neighbours Everton a year ago for £800,000 but has made only five appearances this season.
